content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.A particular moth can infest avocado trees and potentially damage the avocado fruit. A farmer plans to investigate the number of damaged avocado fruit on moth-infested avocado trees of a certain variety. A recent article states that the population distribution of the number of damaged avocado fruit on moth-infested avocado trees of this variety is symmetric with mean <math alttext="mu equals 6.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 1.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Describe the sampling distribution of the sample mean number of damaged avocado fruit, <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math>, for random samples of <math alttext="36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> moth-infested avocado trees of this variety from the population.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.A particular moth can infest avocado trees and potentially damage the avocado fruit. A farmer plans to investigate the number of damaged avocado fruit on moth-infested avocado trees of a certain variety. A recent article states that the population distribution of the number of damaged avocado fruit on moth-infested avocado trees of this variety is symmetric with mean <math alttext="mu equals 6.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 1.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Describe the sampling distribution of the sample mean number of damaged avocado fruit, <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math>, for random samples of <math alttext="36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> moth-infested avocado trees of this variety from the population.

(b) Calculate and interpret the value of <math alttext="the probability of, x bar is greater than 5.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>></mo><mn>5.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the question.

The farmer plans to conduct a study to investigate whether there is a difference between the number of damaged avocado fruit for moth-infested avocado trees of this variety when one of two insecticides is applied. The farmer randomly assigned <math alttext="70" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> avocado trees of this variety from his farm to be treated with one of the two insecticides at first sign of infestation, with <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> being treated with Insecticide X and <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> being treated with Insecticide Y. At the end of the growing season, a worker on the farm, who was not aware of each tree’s assigned insecticide, counted the number of damaged avocado fruit on each tree. The two dotplots given below display the results of the study. (c) Based on the dotplots, write a few sentences comparing the distributions of the number of damaged avocado fruit for the trees treated with Insecticide X and the trees treated with Insecticide Y.

The farmer will conduct a hypothesis test to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that there is a difference between the two population means. Let <math alttext="mu sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the mean number of damaged avocado fruit on all moth-infested avocado trees similar to those in the study that could have been treated with Insecticide X, and let <math alttext="mu sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the mean number of damaged avocado fruit on all moth-infested avocado trees similar to those in the study that could have been treated with Insecticide Y. The hypotheses for the test are as follows.<math alttext="H sub 0: mu sub X equals mu sub Y. H sub a: mu sub X is not equal to mu sub Y." display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>(d) After examining the two dotplots, the farmer is concerned that a condition for the test may not be satisfied. Explain why the farmer should not be concerned.

A <math alttext="99 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>99</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confidence interval for a difference between the population means (Insecticide X minus Insecticide Y) is <math alttext="0.857 plus or minus 1.196" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.857</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.196</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(e) Based on the confidence interval, what conclusion should the farmer make for the hypothesis test? Justify your answer.

(f) Based on the conclusion from part (e), describe, in the context of the study, the type of error (Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> or Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) the farmer might have made, and also describe a consequence of making this type of error.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
